title: Understanding x-intercept
text: The x-intercept occurs where the function value h(x) is $$0$$. This means you'll set the equation $$\log_{4}\left(x-1\right)+1$$ equal to $$0$$ to find the x-intercept.

title: Isolating the Logarithm
text: To solve for $$x$$, start by isolating the logarithm term $$\log_{4}\left(x-1\right)$$. This can be done by subtracting $$1$$ from both sides of the equation.

title: Rewriting the Equation
text: Rewrite the equation so that you can see it more clearly. You should have $$\log_{4}\left(x-1\right)=-1$$ after subtracting $$1$$ from both sides.

title: Exponential Form
text: Convert the logarithmic equation $$\log_{4}\left(x-1\right)=-1$$ into an exponential equation. The base here is $$4$$.

title: Transforming the Equation
text: By using the definition of a logarithm, transform $$\log_{4}\left(x-1\right)=-1$$ to its exponential form: $$4^{-1}$$.

title: Solving the Equation
text: Once you have the equation $$x-1=\frac{1}{4}$$, solve for $$x$$. Please enter your answer in the form $$x=a$$ where a is the solution.

title: Finding the Coordinate Pair
text: To write the x-intercept as a coordinate pair, remember that it is in the form (x, 0) since h(x) equals $$0$$ at the intercept. Please enter your answer in the form (a, 0) where a is the solution for $$x$$.
